item.title: Laura add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "I have never allowed a gentleman to dictate to me, or to interfere with anything I do." -- Henry James

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Memories do not always soften with time; some grow edges like knives." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Listen. Slide the weight from your shoulders and move forward. You are afraid you might forget, but you never will. You will forgive and remember." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Everything you're sure is right can be wrong in another place. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Will you explain to me why people encourage delusional behaviour in children, and medicate it in adults?" -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "In a lifetime of hearing people celebrate weekends, she finally saw what all the fuss was about. By no means did her workload cease on Saturday, but it did shift gears. If her kids wanted to pull everything out of the laundry basket to make a bird's nest and sit in it, fine. Dellarobia could even sit in there with them and incubate, if she so desired. Household chores no longer called her name exclusively. She had an income. She'd never before understood how much her life in this little house had felt to her like confinement in a sinking vehicle after driving off a bridge. ..... To open a hatch and swim away felt miraculous. Working outside the home took her about fifty yards from her kitchen, which was far enough. She couldn't see the dishes in the sink." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "A certain feeling comes from throwing your good life away, and it is one part rapture." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "At some point in the evening Dellarobia had stopped being amazed that Ovid had turned into someone new, and understood he had become himself, in the presence of his wife. With the sense of a great weight settling, she recognized marriage. Not the precarious risk she's balanced for years against forbidden fruits, something easily lost in a brittle moment by flying away or jumping a train to ride off on someone else's steam. She was not about to lose it. She'd never had it." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "In her experience people had worries or they had tons of money, not both." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The most important thing about a person is always the thing you don't know." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "There is a strange moment in time, after something horrible happens, when you know it's true, but you haven't told anyone yet." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "As long as I kept moving, my grief streamed out behind me like a swimmer's long hair in water. I knew the weight was there but it didn't touch me. Only when I stopped did the slick, dark stuff of it come floating around my face, catching my arms and throat till I began to drown. So I just didn't stop." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It is true that I do not speak as well as I can think. But that is true of most people, as nearly as I can tell." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Oh, mercy. If it catches you in the wrong frame of mind, the King James Bible can make you want to drink poison in no uncertain terms." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "This is what it means to be alone: everyone is connected to everyone else, their bodies are a bright liquid life flowing around you, sharing a single heart that drives them to move all together. If the shark comes they will all escape, and leave you to be eaten." -- Barbara Kingsolver
